item.title: Next Steps
item.description: I’ve learned the basics of how the Wintersmith templates work. In the process I have also learned the basics of git, github, grunt, npm, etc, etc. There are a lot of pieces to these things! When I have time I’d like to learn more about node.js, responsive design, and several hundred other things that might be helpful.

item.title: Another thing
item.description:
Adding posts to the folders seems a bit complicated. It sounds like there are a couple of others who also decided to change that. When I have time, I’ll read these articles:

  • http://marcocarag.com/2014/03/30/migrating-my-blog-s-content-to-wintersmith/
  • http://andrewphilipclark.com/

item.title: A Second Post
item.description: Adding another couple of posts to the system…

item.title: Success!
item.description:
This project uses the Wintersmith static web site generator. My goals for doing this project were to:

  1. Learn how to host a free web site on Github.
  2. Learn how Markdown might be used to author documents.
  3. Learn how a static web site generator that uses Markdown works.
  4. Update my CSS skills.
  5. Experiment with responsive grids.

Many thanks to the developer of Wintersmith, as well as:

  • Simple Grid
  • YearlongHackathon (for explaining how to add the partials section for Jade that I was able to use to auto generate the menu sidebar).

and so many other articles that were read in the google browsathon that it took to get this initial web site up!
